newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH BOURSE MULLS INDEX FOR BONDS.
newsitem.headline: POLISH BOURSE MULLS INDEX FOR BONDS.

text.p: The Warsaw Stock Exchange is working on an index for listed floating rate government bonds which would reflect their average yield, a bourse official said on Tuesday.

"The idea is to create an index... based on a portfolio of all flaoting rate bonds which are traded in the signle price auction system," bourse's deputy director of the promotion department Arkadiusz Szymanek told Reuters.
The bourse now lists one-year and three-year government bonds in the single price auction system.
He said the index would be introduced when liquidity and the number of transactions increases to a sufficient degree.
